results.title: The Haunted huntress. Night of the leopard
results.creator_credit: Owen Newman, Amanda Barrett, Keith Scholey, National Geographic Society and BBC
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “World of wildlife”.
Narrated by David Attenborough, “The Haunted huntress” looks at the changing fortunes of a cheetah mother and her cubs as they attempt to survive the harsh environment of Kenya’s Masai Mara. “Night of the leopard” reveals the amazing nocturnal world of a leopard mother and her cubs as she battles with lions, hyenas and crocodiles.

results.title: World of Pets
results.creator_credit: Alan Degen, Sidney Platt and National Geographic Society
results.brief_description: Each program looks at a particular pet and shows how you can learn about animal behavior through the care of animals. The programs also give tips on how to look after pets.

group_works.title: Cats
group_works.creator_credit: Alan Degen, Sidney Platt and National Geographic Society

results.title: Cats
results.creator_credit: Alan Degen and National Geographic Society
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “World of pets”.
This video explores the life of a housecat, from the time of its birth, through its early months of development to adulthood. It explores a cats ability to always land on its feet, its natural agility and flexibility. Also explained are the cat’s mechanisms of perception and communication; the use of the tongue, specialised scent glands, ears and whiskers and its voice. Suitable for Mid-Upper Primary level students. Teachers guide included.

results.title: World of pets : Fish
results.creator_credit: Dennis B. Kane and National Geographic Society
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “World of pets”.
This film explores the world of fish by demonstrating to students how to set up an aquarium and how to care for goldfish, as well as a practical discussion of the anatomy, perception and breeding behaviour of fish. Students will discover that fish not only make colourful pets but that they also can be used to explore animal behaviour and to teach responsibility. Suitable for Middle-Upper Primary level students. Teacher’s guide included.

results.title: World of pets : dogs
results.creator_credit: Chris Brown and National Geographic Society
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “World of pets”.
This film explores the world of the dog as a companion to humans. By focussing on a golden retriever and her puppies, from birth to maturity, we observe the dog’s behaviour as it interacts with other dogs and the human family which adopts it. Suitable for Middle-Upper Primary level students. Teacher’s guide included.

results.creator_credit: Hal Weiner, Marilyn Weiner and Screenscope
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “World of Cooking”.
Presents a Southern German meal prepared with flair by master Chef Helmut Abrell, to whom cooking is an art form.

results.title: Cooking of France: an alpine menu
results.creator_credit: Hal Weiner, Marilyn Weiner and Screenscope Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “World of Cooking”.
A film which demonstrates that fine French cuisine can be prepared simply, but elegantly, using basic skills and ingredients. Join the amiable Master Chef, Andre Revest, on a tour of his kitchen and his native Dauphiny Alps region.
